Package fileSystem

Class FileSystem

java.lang.Object
fileSystem.FileSystem
public class FileSystem extends Object
This class is a virtual file system that stores directories and files.

  • Method Details

    • createFileSystemInstance

      public static FileSystem createFileSystemInstance()
      If file system hasn't been created before, create a new file system; else return the reference to the file system
      Returns:
      the reference to a single file system

    • getRoot

      public Directory getRoot()
      Return root directory of the file system

    • getFileSystem

      public FileSystemObject getFileSystem​(String path)

    • getDirectoryAndFileName

      public DirectoryFileNameTuple getDirectoryAndFileName​(Directory curDir, String path) throws Exception
      This method is used when trying to create or access some file or directory with the path. Gets the directory from which the file/directory is attempted to be created/accessed from and its name
      Parameters:
      shellState - holds state of the program including root directory and current directory
      path - is the specified path that indicates which file/directory is attempted to be created/accessed
      Returns:
      a tuple that holds directory from which the file/directory is attempted to be created/accessed from and its name
      Throws:
      Exception - if the given path is invalid

    • getFileSystemObject

      public FileSystemObject getFileSystemObject​(Directory curDir, String path) throws Exception
      This method is used when trying to access some file system object such as file or directory with the path.
      Parameters:
      shellState - holds state of the program including root directory and current directory
      path - is the specified path that indicates which file/directory is attempted to be accessed
      Returns:
      a the file system object indicated by path
      Throws:
      Exception - if the object does not exist at given path

    • getFileByPath

      public File getFileByPath​(Directory curDir, String path) throws Exception
      Get the file specified by path
      Parameters:
      shellState - holds state of the program including root directory and current directory
      path - is the specified path(complete or relative)
      Returns:
      path described by path
      Throws:
      Exception - if the path specified object at this path is not a file

    • getDirectoryByPath

      public Directory getDirectoryByPath​(Directory curDir, String path) throws Exception
      Get the directory specified by path
      Parameters:
      shellState - holds state of the program including root directory and current directory
      path - is the specified path(complete or relative)
      Returns:
      directory described by path
      Throws:
      Exception - if the path specified object at this path is not a directory

    • getTreeRepresentation

      public String getTreeRepresentation()
      Return tree representation of current file system

    • moveFsObject

      public void moveFsObject​(Directory curDir, String oldPath, String newPath) throws Exception
      Move an object from one path to another (path can be absolute or relative to given directory)
      Parameters:
      curDir - given directory
      oldPath - is the path of object to be moved
      newPath - is the path of object to be moved into
      Throws:
      Exception - if either of the paths are invalid or if trying to move a directory inside one of its sub-directories

    • copyFsObject

      public void copyFsObject​(Directory curDir, String oldPath, String newPath) throws Exception
      Copy an object from one path to another (path can be absolute or relative to given directory)
      Parameters:
      curDir - given directory
      oldPath - is the path of object to be moved
      newPath - is the path of object to be moved into
      Throws:
      Exception - if either of the paths are invalid or if trying to move a directory inside one of its sub-directories
